title: British Fed Cup star Katie Boulter targets comeback in Turkey after recovering from back injury
text:
British Fed Cup star Katie Boulter looks finally ready to resume her career after nearly six months spent battling injury.

The 23-year-old from Leicestershire is hoping to play in less than two weeks at a lower level event in Turkey after recovering from a stress fracture in her lower back, five months after her late withdrawal from the French Open.

Boulter has not been seen since her Fed Cup singles victory against Kazakhstan on April 21. Gallingly, a subsequent change to the competition’s format meant Britain’s win counted for little.

Katie Boulter finally ready to resume her career after nearly six months spent battling injury

The injury abruptly stopped a promising 2019 campaign which saw Boulter gain a first Australian Open win and notch up other Fed Cup victories in February.

She then took some criticism for entering the Roland Garros draw in May before withdrawing late and claiming half the first-round prize money.

In her absence she has slipped to No 260 in the world, but is now training in Spain with coach Jeremy Bates ahead of her scheduled return.

Jo Konta, meanwhile, is due to return next week at Moscow’s Kremlin Cup. Her slender hopes of qualifying for the year-end WTA Finals in China were extinguished by the knee injury which has kept her out since making the quarter-finals of the US Open last month.
description: British Fed Cup star Katie Boulter looks finally ready to resume her career after nearly six months spent battling injury.
authors: Mike Dickson For The Daily Mail
